alert.note: Alert for Knox; Loudon; North Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LOUDON... SOUTHWESTERN KNOX...BLOUNT AND WEST CENTRAL SEVIER COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EDT... At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Maryville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Alcoa, Farragut, Pigeon Forge, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, and Greenback. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown.
